{"step_by_step_thinking": "Metoprolol is a beta-blocker commonly used to treat hypertension. Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker. When verapamil is added to the therapy of a patient already on metoprolol, it can result in an additive effect on cardiac conduction and heart rate. This can lead to bradycardia with AV block.", "answer_choice": "B"}
